key_channel_insights.line_content: The OTA channel demonstrates stable pricing, with minimal price differences and improved parity across short and long haul routes.
The MSE channel shows a strong price advantage, with the majority of fares priced lower than TAP Air Portugal's website.
The GDS channel exhibits predominantly higher prices compared to TAP's website, underscoring a continuing markup trend.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: The OTA channel shows a relatively stable pricing pattern with a minimal last-week average price difference of 0.03%, highlighting consistent fare displays.
A 11.05% increase in the frequency of prices being the same on the OTA channel compared to the previous week suggests improved pricing parity.
OTAs mostly show minor price discrepancies, with OTA higher fares slightly increasing by 1.42% compared to the previous week.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 11.62% decline in instances where the airline's web offer was not found on the OTA channel indicates better alignment in terms of visibility.
Instances where OTAs displayed higher prices increased slightly by 1.42% versus the previous week, suggesting occasional pricing misalignments.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul routes saw an 11.31% increase in same pricing frequency over the last week, indicating more consistent fare alignment.
9.41% increase in same pricing for long haul suggests that the OTA channel is offering more competitive fares vis-à-vis the airline’s own website.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For Portugal-origin flights, 11.74% more instances of same pricing this week showcases excellent consistency in pricing.
Non-PT origins saw a 10.14% increase in same pricing, suggesting improvements in OTA fare alignment.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings saw a 10.08% rise in same pricing frequency over the week, indicating growing OTA-web price consistency.
13.28% improvement for far-out bookings with same price frequency is indicative of long-term pricing stability.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE channel consistently shows lower prices compared to TAP Air Portugal's website, with 71.06% of offers lower last week.
There is a slight increase in the frequency of MSE lower pricing from the previous week by 11.58%, showing a growing trend favoring MSE discounts.

mse_highlights.line_title: Minimal Instances of Higher MSE Pricing
mse_highlights.line_content: Instances where MSE prices were higher than the airline's website are few and have shown a negligible increase, indicating strong competitive pricing on the MSE channel.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: There is a significant portion of TAP offers not found on MSE, decreasing marginally by 13.04% from the previous week.
Only 3.44% of MSE offers matched the airline's website last week, reflecting negligible changes over the month with a consistent price similarity.
The proportion of MSE lower offers rose by 11.58% compared to the previous week, solidifying MSE's competitive advantage.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul routes demonstrate significant discounts on the MSE channel, with 73.72% of offers priced lower than the airline's website last week.
Long haul routes also show a strong MSE price advantage, with 54.01% lower-pricing frequency, consistent across the previous month.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Flights originating in Portugal show a strong trend towards MSE lower prices, with a sharp 12.84% increase in such offers last week.
Non-PT origins maintain significant MSE discounts with a 66.67% lower-pricing occurrence last week, slightly increased compared to previous trends.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in booking windows witness substantial MSE price advantages, with 70.12% of offerings priced lower, an improvement over previous periods.
Far-out bookings maintain steady MSE lower-price trends, with a consistent 72.98% of offers reflecting this advantage last week.

gds_highlights.line_content: In the GDS channel, fares were predominantly higher than on TAP's own site, seen in 68.32% of offers, increasing 13.95% week-over-week.
A significant 24.30% of TAP's offers on their site are not found in the GDS channel, highlighting a coverage gap.
Only 0.50% of offers are cheaper in GDS compared to TAP's site, with a negligible weekly frequency change.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: There was a decrease in itineraries not available on GDS compared to both previous week and month, but they still represent about 24% of all GDS data.
The frequency of cases where GDS prices are higher increased by nearly 14% from last week, indicating a notable markup over direct sales.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul routes often have GDS prices higher than TAP's site 67.82% of the time, with a 13.78% increase in that frequency weekly.
Long haul flights present even higher GDS prices than TAP's site in 70.97% of the cases, with a slightly more steady increase in comparison to short haul routes.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For flights originating in Portugal, 69.32% have higher fares in GDS compared to TAP's site, marking a 14% uptick from the previous week.
Non-Portugal originating routes show a similar trend with GDS channel fares being higher 66.67% of the time, also showing a substantial weekly increase in this status.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings frequently show higher GDS prices, affecting 67.88% of itineraries with a 14.99% increase observed weekly.
For far-out bookings, while the overall percentage of higher GDS pricing remains high at 69.06%, the weekly growth is modest at 11.61%.
